title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Monday 23 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: woman dies after glenfield house fire .
reaction to leicester tigers heavy home defeat .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live - updates will start again at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: weather : freezing fog
text: it 'll be a cloudy and cold night with mist and fog becoming more widespread in the early hours .
lows of 0c with a frost likely in places .
expect frost and fog to begin with on tuesday - some fog patches could be quite dense with the potential for some tricky driving conditions .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : geese at watermead country park
text: thanks to julie christie for sending in this great action shot from watermead country park over the weekend
author: Facebook

documents.title: horse had 'horrific injuries ' to its face
text: sheona morley is the rspca inspector who went out to see the horse in skeffington .
she said : `` tyre tracks on the ground showed that whoever dumped her had pulled away in their truck , resulting in the horse falling on to the floor .
as a result of this impact , the horse had horrific injuries to one side of her face .
`` when i arrived the horse was making moaning sounds - it was absolutely horrific .
`` frost had formed on her face and mane .
thankfully , someone who lived locally was able to bring a large blanket to put over her . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: house fire deaths a 'terrible tragedy '
text: `` this is a terrible tragedy and the thoughts of the service are with the family and friends of the deceased .
we are fortunate that this type of incident happens very infrequently and we continue to educate our communities in home fire safety to prevent these types of deaths . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: house fire caused by smoking material
text: the cause of the fire has now been investigated and found to be `` accidental '' caused by `` carelessly discarded smoking materials '' .
the fire service has said it will be working in the glenfield area over the next few days to provide reassurance and advice to local people about avoiding a similar scenario .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman dies after glenfield house fire
text: a woman has died after a house fire in glenfield on friday .
the fire service has said it was called to the house on lynmouth close just after 17:00 .
firefighters found the fire was already out and the casualty was being treated .
they 've said they she was taken to hospital but has since died .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: horse found with fatal injuries in skeffington
text: a vet had to put this horse down over the weekend after it was found `` left for dead '' in skeffington
the rspca charity has said the horse was found on saturday morning by a dog walker - it 's back legs were tied to railings and it had `` horrific injuries '' to one side of its face .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester tigers at the 'bottom of the pit '
text: captain tom youngs has said only hard work and a return to the basics will arrest leicester tigers ' worst run of form in more than 13 years .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: knifepoint robbery in ellistown
text: a van driver was robbed at knifepoint in ellistown on wednesday .
police have told us he was approched by two men on kendal road who demanded the keys to the van - he refused to begin with but then one of them threatened him with a knife .
the victim handed over the keys and the two men took the vehicle - it was later found abandoned in ibstock .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: warning for freezing fog
text: the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for freezing fog in leicestershire tonight .
the warning is in place from 17:00 tonight till 11:00 on tuesday morning .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police appeal after nightclub assault
text: do you recognise any of these men ?
police would like to speak to them after a person was assaulted in a nightclub on belgrave gate in leicester .
it happened on saturday 3 december at around 2:40 - the victim has to go to hospital for treatment to his spleen , lungs and ribs .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : could brexit harm our environment ?
text: ben jackson finds out how brexit could effect our wildlife
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: gritters out in leicester
text: looks like it 's going to be another cold night
temperatures are due to drop below freezing tonight , so our # gritting teams will be out in # leicester from 10pm # grittertwitter
salt of the earth those lads
boom boom !
surprised we do n't get more replies like that
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: straw still smouldering after fire in hathern
text: a massive '' straw stack blaze at a local farm and cafe business could have been arson , according to leicestershire fire and rescue service .
author: Loughborough Echo

documents.title: your photo : crisp sunrise in leicestershire
text: this lovely photo was taken by suej in holwell yesterday morning
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: what do leicester city and ipswich town have in common ?
text: leicester city 's current haul of 21 points from 22 games is the joint-worst return for reigning champions in top-flight history .
they share the record with ipswich who had the same total for the 1962-63 season , after converting from two to three points for a win .
this was the ipswich team riding through the town in triumph on 15 may 1962 .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: burning car 'sounded like explosion '
text: neighbours living near the lane where the car was found burnt out heard a loud bang and said it sounded `` like a bomb ''
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: plenty of cloud around through the afternoon but there will also be some bright and even sunny weather with patches of blue sky emerging between the clouds .
some occasional fog patches lingering with highs of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: car found burnt out in barwell
text: the vehicle allegedly involved in a hit-and-run was later found burnt out several miles away
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man bailed over hit-and-run
text: a .
22-year-old man arrested in connection with a hit-and-run in barwell has been released on bail .
a pedestrian was seriously injured after the collision on kirkby road at about 22:30 on saturday , and remains in hospital .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : sandy 's last flight
text: on facebook you 've been commenting on the story of sandy saunders making his last flight in a world war ii plane
karen anderson said : `` this is a beautiful tribute . ''
sam daz mistry said : `` a real-life hero thank you to sandy and all your comrades . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: juror illness delays baby manslaughter trial
text: the case of chuanfang zheng , accused of the manslaughter of her niece , has been adjourned today because two members of the jury are ill .
author: Victoria Hicks
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : lighting a pub 's gas lamps
text: the globe is only the fourth pub in the country known to use gas lamps
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gas lamps expected to attract tourists
text: chris is the manager at the globe and said it has n't been that difficult to get the lamps working again .
he thinks some of the system could be as old as the pub - that 's 300-years-old .
one customer said : `` it 's really nice to see them back on .
they 've not had them on for a little while .
`` when they used to have the gas lamps on people used to come just because it was a big feature of the pub . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pub has gas lamps restored
text: are you old enough to remember pubs in leicester being lit by these ?
maybe you would n't admit to it .
this is at the globe on silver street - the pub was known for using its gas lamps a few years ago but then it stopped .
now the lamps have been checked over for safety and are back in action again .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more trains for football fans
text: if you 're one of the lucky people that managed to get a ticket for the derby county v leicester city fa cup match next friday you might be interested to know some extra trains are being put on for fans
# emtnews : east midlands announces extra trains for derby county vs leicester city fa cup fourth-round tie see here :
what happened to the second late train ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thousands caught using a mobile behind the wheel
text: despite our best efforts to educate motorists as to the dangers of being distracted by using a mobile phone while driving , leicestershire police recorded 2,399 mobile phone offences in the three years from january 2014 to december 2016 .
we fully support this national campaign and hope that it helps reduce the numbers of those people killed or seriously injured on our roads . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university building evacuated
text: well the fire alarm at the university of leicester 's new centre for medicine works
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: tougher penalty for using a phone while driving
text: police across the east midlands are reminding people of this today
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fog affecting flights this morning
text: east midlands airport says fog and poor visibility is affecting flights this morning .
they have advised passengers to check the status of their flights with their airline before travelling to the airport .
the airport said passengers should expect delays to flights and cancellations of some short haul and domestic uk flights .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: local reaction to 'micro office '
text: this morning , i asked commuters arriving or leaving from leicester 's railway station whether they could see themselves paying to use a mobile office on the street - i 'm afraid i could n't find one person who thought `` yes this is just what i need '' .
most told me they could use their mobile phone to scan documents and , of course , make calls .
the two red phone boxes already have glass panes smashed and have been graffitied .
one lady feared putting in expensive equipment would only encourage them to be further vandalised .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: work while you wait for a train
text: miles broe is the architect who 's been commissioned to transform the phone boxes on behalf of the red kiosk company .
he said that inside will be a scanner , printer and of course - a telephone .
he said it will make it possible for people to work while waiting at the railway station for a train .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : swans on a frozen pond
text: this lovely video has been sent in by jim mitchell snr on facebook - it shows a swan leading the way through a frozen pond at bradgate park , making way for other birds
author: Facebook

documents.title: new use for old phone box
text: when was the last time you used one of these ?
in fairness these phone boxes outside leicester railway station are locked so you would n't be able to anyway .
this could change though as an application has been submitted to the city council to turn the phone boxes into something new - .
a micro office space .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester defeat shows when a diamond does not work
text: leicester 's defeat at southampton was a great example of how tactics , rather than players , are hugely important in deciding football matches .

you still need a talented , intelligent team with the ability to carry those tactics out for you , of course , but your system can win or lose a game for you - just the same as an amazing bit of skill will .
they played it really poorly , because it looked to me as if they had not worked on it very much .
more on this here .
author: Danny Murphy
Former England midfielder on BBC Match of the Day

documents.title: southampton v leicester stats
text: here 's how southampton and leicester compared in yesterday 's match
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : ranieri blames himself for another away defeat
text: it was n't just the leicester tigers who suffered a heavy defeat this weekend - leicester city lost 3-0 over in southampton .
boss claudio ranieri takes responsibility
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : cold start to the week 's weather
text: watch : cold start to the week 's weather
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : veteran takes to the skies for his last-ever flight
text: my film on sandy saunders - his last mission to make sure the guinea pig club is never forgotten
see the full story tonight on inside out tonight on bbc one at 19:30 .
author: Victoria Hicks
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: extra police patrols in city park
text: detectives are investigating a spate of robberies in victoria park in leicester .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: barwell hit-and-run
text: there was a hit-and-run in barwell over the weekend involving two cars and a pedestrian .
it happened on kirkby road at about 22:30 on saturday - the driver of one of the cars drove off and the car was found burnt out a few miles away .
the pedestrian is in hospital in a stable condition and police have arrested a 22-year-old man on sus of gbh and drink driving .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : 'embarrassing for all involved '
text: tigers boss aaron mauger reacts to the 43-0 champions cup thrashing from glasgow warriors
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: leicester tigers at their 'lowest point '
text: there 's no two ways about it - it is the lowest point .
we 've had low points over the last two or three decades , like the sacking of dean richards , but on the whole it 's been a success story .
over the last three or four weeks it 's probably been the worst time for being a tigers fan seeing the demise of the tigers this season .
it 's very depressing .
i ca n't see a light at the end of the tunnel .
author: Bleddyn Jones
BBC Radio Leicester Tigers Commentator

documents.title: listen : 'worst ever tigers performance '
text: it was a really tough weekend of sport in leicester - especially for tigers fans .
aaron mauger 's side lost 43-0 to glasgow at welford road
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: kibworth school closure
text: about to do the school run ?
if you live in kibworth you might need to stay put because the local primary school is closed
kibworth primary school is closed today .
no water supply so no heating .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: oh yes it 's monday morning already - sorry - i hope you all had a lovely weekend .
i 'll be writing the updates on leicestershire local live today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to comment on any of the stories discussed on the page you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
